title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 18, ch. II, subch. J, pt. 726 - Application For Authorization To Represent Goods And Articles As Blind Made Or Processed Products Pursuant To Sections 396-f And 396-g Of The General Business Law
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 18, ch. II, subch. J, pt. 726 - Application For Authorization To Represent Goods And Articles As Blind Made Or Processed Products Pursuant To Sections 396-f And 396-g Of The General Business Law

State Regulations
§ 726.1 - Applications for registration and authorization to use an official imprint, stamp, symbol or label, designed or approved by the commission, to identify goods and articles as blind made or processed products
§ 726.2 - Amendments to application
§ 726.3 - Withdrawal of applications
§ 726.4 - Registrations and the authorizations valid for one year
§ 726.5 - Records
§ 726.6 - Decisions
§ 726.7 - Hearings
§ 726.8 - Second authorization not required
§ 726.9 - Active enforcement by the commission

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 18, ch. II, subch. J, pt. 726

Statutory authority: N.Y. Const., art. XVII, § 2; Social

Services Law, §§17, 20, 34, 38; General Business Law, §396-F; L. 1971, ch. 110, § 83

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
